title: libc symbols are included in cross-compiled static libraries
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

Symbols such as `memcpy` are included in static libraries built for (at least) `thumbv7em-none-eabihf`.

I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(lang_items)]
#![no_builtins]
#![no_std]

use core::panic::PanicInfo;
use core::ffi::c_void;

extern "C" {
    fn memcpy(dest: *mut c_void, src: *const c_void, size: usize) -> *mut c_void;
}

#[no_mangle]
pub extern "C" fn rust_copy(src: &[u8], dst: &mut [u8]) {
    assert!(dst.len() == src.len());
    unsafe {
        memcpy(dst.as_mut_ptr() as *mut c_void, src.as_ptr() as *const c_void, dst.len());
    }
}

#[panic_handler]
fn panic(_: &PanicInfo) -> ! {
    loop {}
}

#[lang = "eh_personality"]
extern fn eh_personality() {}
```

```
$ rustc +nightly --crate-type=staticlib test.rs --target=thumbv7em-none-eabihf
$ nm --defined-only --extern-only libtest.a | grep memcpy
00000001 W __aeabi_memcpy
00000001 W __aeabi_memcpy4
00000001 W __aeabi_memcpy8
00000001 T __llvm_memcpy_element_unordered_atomic_1
00000001 T __llvm_memcpy_element_unordered_atomic_2
00000001 T __llvm_memcpy_element_unordered_atomic_4
00000001 T memcpy
```

I expected to see this happen: I expected the `memcpy` symbol to be undefined in the generated static library.

Instead, this happened: The `memcpy` symbol is defined in the generated static library.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc +nightly --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.43.0-nightly (834bc5650 2020-02-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 834bc5650acf7019a53b409db68986857822812c
commit-date: 2020-02-24
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.43.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```
